content: A 5 star game that looks nice and is beginner friendly. While it's not great that this is a mobile only game since touch controls are bad at best, the game itself is soild. DQ4 is Shorter the most modern RPGs.
Okay but freezes when you tap "Appraise" in menu

No controller support.

If the have could implement controller support, that would be nice. Otherwise, the touch controls are okay. DQ1 had nicer touch controls. Even better would be tap navigation and or full tap integration (tap a tile to walk to that tile, tap an NPC to talk to them, etc.. ) Aside from that, this is Dragon Quest 4 and is just as good as it's always been. Graphics are pretty, game runs fine.
Fairly faithful port of an NES classic. One of the bugs that I've encountered is in Chapter 3. Any time I try to appraise items with Taloon, it freezes the app.
Dragon warrior 4 hell yea
I luv the game but what happened dw7
Dq3 is better ,IMO. BIGGER MAP , CHOICE OF MEMBERS.

It's a good remake/port of the original! Just wish they kept the difficulty level the same as the original as well, it's the same problem I've had with most NES RPG ports. Just no real challenge compared to the original. Still fun thoughüòÖ

I played through the whole game, plus Post-Game content. It's a fantastic story (one of the best in the series) with some of the most memorable characters in the series. It also fixes the botched lack of party speak that the DS failed to have, get this game as soon as you can. Hopefully, it'll get a Console and PC port alongside every DQ game in the series.
Cloud saves function doesn't work. It just sets on a black screen with a spinning circle in the top left corner. Please fix this
Wish all the Dragon Quest games were on Steam or Switch but playing on Mobile isn't too bad. Enjoying the game so far 11 hours in and just starting Chapter 5.

The game is great definitely a must buy of old school JRPG gamers from the 8-bit nes era of gaming. The text corrections to forigen language like English with European like grammatical framing to me isn't an issue as it gives it needed character as the game dies not have voiceovers like the recent dq games released on the PS2/PS4. However there is no buletooth controller support for those with a controller to use to play it using non touchscreen input commands which kills the gameplay for me.

I'm glad I managed to play this game with their talking function fully functional... I played it in DS the last time so it didn't have any, but anyway the control is a bit hard at first... But you will get used to it
Good game
cant turn off sound, so much starting over at lvl 1, torneko bug is just annoying enough to uninstall

A fantastic game! I have no idea how I missed this back in the day. Being a huge Final Fantasy fan this reminds me of ff4. Multiple character parties and perspectives with each civilization of people having their own accents.

This is a fun, and amazing game in the Zenithian trilogy. This game is the definitive version of Dragon Quest IV and I highly recommend you get it. It really is just a DS port with the party chat feature that was left out in that version. The only thing that truly bugs me is the fact that at the time of this review, the game crashes whenever you use the merchant Torneko's "Appraise" ability. Torneko gives his own unique commentary on the items, but we miss out on that. Still a great title.
Fantastic game, phone controls are a bit wierd at first but you'll quickly get used to it. 30+ hour rpg, of all the dq games on the play store I think my favorite are dq4 and dq3!
I just I love the game, and it one of my favorite games in the series.
I played the whole game but, got stuck at the final boss due to the switching mechanic being broken. I played for about 40 hours to get to the final boss.
I love this game, currently I am at chapter 3, and I have a problem, when Torneko uses the appraise skill, the game crashes.
I beat this a couple of times for the Nintendo and I was disappointed when we didn't get the PlayStation version. Now that I could get it for the Android, I got a great experience.

TL;DR: great, but has game-breaking glitches. This is the definitive version of Dragon Quest IV, featuring everything good about the fantastic, albeit incomplete, Nintendo DS remake from 2008 in addition to the wonderful party chat feature which was missing from that version of the game. However, I can't give this game the positive rating it deserves because, as of version 1.1.1, it consistently freezes every time you try to use the character Torneko's 'Appraise' ability. Wait for a patch.
Superb RPG‚Äîone of the finest games in the Dragon Quest series. Great story, characters and music, as you would expect from a DQ game, plus the episodic storytelling is particularly entertaining.

One of the best jrpg's around. The ability to upload your save to the cloud and carry on playing somewhere else on another system is great. Characters and story are brilliant, amount of content is massive. Good value for money.

This is an enhanced port of the DS version. Runs great on my Pixel 2 XL, but the demands of the game aren't high so it should run even on aging hardware. Sideloaded it onto my Fire HD8 tablet and the game still runs nicely there, and those tablet components are bargain-bin level. Fun RPG. A little basic by modern standards but if you enjoy grinding the game is over in 25ish hours. I enjoyed it.
I love it
This game has a great story and wonderfully converted controls for the mobile platform. We'll worth the money to have this in your catalogue.

I'm not a huge fan of being able to rotate the camera but I got used to it quickly; my real issue arises whenever I try to appraise something with Torneko Taloon- the game freezes every time. I'm only on chapter 3 so, maybe it wont freeze when I try to appraise something in the final chapter? Still, VERY annoying, especially if this doesn't get fixed. Otherwise, good remake of a good classic.
Love this series, one of my favorites
Please change the control system back to how it is on the first three games. Why must I be connected to the internet to play?!
Bug inn suppose to replenish hp same when you level up both dont replenish . This needs fixing asap
It's fun when I played the first day, now the game won't load to the main menu. Would be a 5 star if I could still play.

This is my first time playing any DQ, and I can safely recommend this version for beginners. Solid mobile port of a great game, and the way the story is structured makes it an excellent tutorial for turn based RPG gameplay in general. Controls work well, I just wish the Dpad recentered at the start of each motion like in most other modern mobile games. Still it is very admirable that SE keeps updating the game for compatibility with latest devices years after release.
Great game.
I can't use the save file in my cloud storage.
Great port, incredible game, well worth the money.
Still needs notch support, but I commend the last update for it's support for 18.5:9 resolutions. If this gets an update to support notched displays, it will be an easy five star.

Strongest entry for when it was released. Animations are vastly improved, and it's very fun. Controls can occasionally prompt a text box or two that wasn't wanted, but nothing more than a minor annoyance.
just how i remeber it
An awesome game with a questionable localization.
This and all the other DQ games would be much better with controller support.
Awesome!!!!!!!!!

I've played this game for years since the original NES release, through remakes upon remakes. This game is very clean, and offers to the point where you can't become super over powered, because even then, ther end boss can still wreck you if you don't know what you're doing. Lol.

This is the first game I played in the Dragon Quest series and I loved it, and I haven't really played JRPGs. I liked the unique story presentation and the mobile port looked and ran well. I'll definitely be checking out Dragon Quest 5.
It's great that they have implemented a cloud based saving system. This way, you can keep your saved files if you change phones.

I was wary of the complaints about the translation, but they've proven unfounded. It's quite decent; people are confusing the phonetic spelling and intentionally broken or dialectic english with poor writing. The use of these devices is common in early rpgs, before audible speech and detailed graphics could be used to convey ethnic variations. This adds distinctiveness to each region, though it demands more of the reader (eg: familiarity with legitimate, but obscure words like "ken" and "bairn".)
Awesome port.

I played the original when I was young on DS and I was skeptical as to what this port would be like at first. If you too are skeptical, let me put you at ease. The work they've done here is fantastic and I experienced such fondness and nostalgia while playing through this. It took me about 50 hrs to complete, including all the bonus content that they have included. Even though it's not exactly cheap, I consider it worth every cent. Can't recommend enough!!
Amazing
Best experience jrpg
This game aged really well. The control is also super intuitive for me to play on the go. Classic RPG that is brilliantly made for mobile.
A simple yet charming adventure that tells a story of eight people from vastly different walks of life, coming together to defeat a great evil. One of my favourite games in the Dragon Quest series.
Translation is bad but other than that had an enjoyable time with it is there gonna be a translation update or something
Awesome Rpg love the series

First game to have party members with personality and dialogue. Party chat is incredible, your squad has a ton of things to say about so much and it really makes them feel close and realistic. Sprites are GORGEOUS, they animate INCREDIBLY well and battle animations are cool. Game is a little easy, but still fun. Dungeons are a little short. World map design I enjoyed less than 3 and 2. The quest for the armor could be better, but all in all the game is quite fun.
Solid Dragon Quest gameplay! However, there is a glaring flaw that must be addressed. The translation of the game is in horrible Engrish, which can make some parts of the story confusing to read

Fantastic game when it came out for the Famicom/NES, even better with the quality of life additions and graphical updates. And with party chat added back in for Mobile, this is the definitive remake to play. Having marathoned through the Erdrick Trilogy (DQ1-3) right before this one, I feel like this is really where the series starts to make a name for itself with the story and character development, while refining on the classic Dragon Quest combat loop that's been around from the beginning.
please give us Dragon quest 7 for mobile
good game

An excellent remake of a classic game. I only have one complaint. In chapter one I got the Cautery Sword. I noticed that despite the fact you can use it to cast sizz you can only kill one enemy at a time.
Going through Royal Crypt, stepped on a green glowing thing and the game went white. Music still going, bit of a game breaking bug.

Fantastic entry. The original NES game was really when DQ started to come into its stride with an incredible soundtrack, a cast of lovable characters that you get to know individually through the story, and a massive world full of life and goofy puns. This port does it every justice. The way the game has you learn about each party member by having you play through short stories starring them that all weave together into the longer, main campaign is genius. A great place to enter the series.
I was never able to play IV, V, or VI as a kid, and they are all fantastic. Must play!

always my favorite series, however there is a bug when purchasing items will not cap at 99 (will let you continue to buy therefore losing all purchases beyond 99) in the bag, and the you forgot to change the name from Taloon to the new one, Torneko from the tunnel guard chapter 3 after finishing excavating the tunnel ending chapter 3, and in the Captain's quarter chapter 4 before meena and Maya set off
Great game. Love the series.
awesome game
The worst of the first six games. After spending several hours playing many characters from Level 1, the game finally becomes tolerable and predictable in DQ style.

worst translation in a game ever! regular rpg classic graphics, controls are very slippery, gameplay is fine, but it's so hard to understand what is going on within the story because it's as if a baby is talking threw the whole game.
better than ds version, party chat added, definitive version

Great game. Runs well. I would rate 5, but the fact that you cant mute the music/sound is unreal. It genuinely makes me less inclined to play the game, or buy any of the other Square Enix games that have the same problem.
Another good game.
A great port of an amazing RPG
Very good port.
Drm
Great game.
An amazing port of an often overlooked classic. That this game in any form existed on the NES is mind blowing. But it holds up pretty well regardless. If you were a fan back in the day, grab it now.

This is still one of my favourite games of all time. This port is honestly phenomenal. Movement is smooth and really easy and the controls are great. My only real gripe is I can't seem to figure out how to turn sound off completely, only turn it down a little, in case I want to listen to music while playing.

The first rpg I ever played and the bulk of my child hood memories I still 
remember getting it under the tree all those years ago if you love the 
oldies you can do far worse than Dragon Quest.

Don't listen to the soyboy complaining about a pixel bikini. This is one of 
the best JRPG's you can ever play. A true classic.

A great port of an old game. Challenging and lengthy with all the extra 
content from the DS version. Controls can be a little wonky on touchscreen 
at times. Otherwise great port and great game.
Its just like I remember only prettier! ;-)

Redownloaded the game a year later and no longer works with it saying 
"checking license"

There is a lot of grinding when it comes to dragon quest. Having the right 
weapons and armor with the right characters against the right the right 
monster. help to alleviate the chore. For example, the weapon Dragonbane 
works really well against dragons but not against other monsters. Sometimes 
i switch out all characters except maybe two because the other two lack 
armour for the particular attack (i.e., fire ice).
Game is not starting anymore, it's stuck at the Checking License screen

Very enjoyable game. The user interface is alright, but not great. Would be 
five stars if I could use my Bluetooth controller with the game.

Great but the English is so broken it's painful. 1,2 and 3s English was 
nowhere near as bad
It's a great game (drop the mic).

To all of you complaining about graphics or story or whatever you obviously 
don't realize this game came out for the NES in 1990 of course the graphics 
are going to be simplistic this is a port not a remake. Of course it's 
grindy old games had to pad game times with grinding or difficulty spikes.
Fun!!
A classic that is worth every penny
I love the dragon quest series. Been playing the games for many years regardless of how many times i have finished each one
This game is OK.  The story should be more complex but is simple with no branches.  Graphics and controls are ok.  Simple by today's standards. Somewhat overpriced.
An overhaul to a classic i grew up playing, very happy!
A masterpiece, the greatest franchise ever, a must play for ne1 who never heard of this series.  I played the original nes version, this is a dream come true right on your phone! :)

Graphics are superior to the NES version. Big bonus. I personally don't like that they changed so many names(I miss Primrose. Now I have to settle for Mary Lou) . Also, the real reason for 4 stars is, the translation is really really annoying. They made characters seem like retarded country bumpkins, or they would say stuff like "I was knowing I would see you here". Bad translation. The NES translation( older system by far) was far superior.

I accidentally uninstalled my game i cloud saved it but i cant figure out how to get ny progess back.  I was on the last chapter!!!  Someone know how i can retrieve my old game i really don't want to start over!!!!!!
Great game that I would recommend

I have docked this a star because of its horrible translation. I remember fondly playing the NES version and the translation was ok, not great. This one they have decided to have each chapter take place with regional dialect. Ragnar is Scottish which they made very difficult to read. However, Alena is Russian. But they decided to have read like someone speaking in a Russian accent, but wrote it in extremely broke. English. It's awful.
I don't like the worldliness that is in the game like Mara wearing a bikini. Why can't people make truly 100 percent family games?
Only complaint is I wish I could mute it.
Always been a favorite of mine, and I'm glad to see it resurrected.
Perfect!

DQ4 is the most generic jRPG there is. It's incredibly grindy and boring. It also goes above and beyond being boring with a bad plot progression mechanic. Very often the game won't progress until you talk to a specific npc, and this npc isn't signaled as they all have generic sprites.  As an app, it's okay. It controls well, cloud saves work OK, but the game is very loud relative to your system volume and contains no in game volume controls, so don't buy thinking you'll play it while listening to podcasts.  I can only recommend it if you just want to flush thirty hours down the drain on one of the most bland games I've ever played.

Almost perfectly optimized for phone play.  The story is great, music is beautiful, the world is immersive.  Positives:  It's a DS port, so the portait locked orientation makes sense. they really took finger positioning into account. The controls never get in to way of the game; excellent UI design. The music sounds stunning, even better than the DS version, and the higher resolution on phones make it a pleasure to play.  I also love to mention that no internet acces is required. Saves and quicksaves will always just work as they should regardless of connection. It's rare to see that these days. (I'm looking at you phantasy star II)Thank you for the good etiquette SE <3  Negatives:  I had some problems with cloudsaving on my S7, but it's been fixed in a patch.  there's no controller support unfortunatly.  It comes at a hefty pricetag, but it took me 45 hours to beat this game and I've enjoyed every minute of it.  Conclusion:  It's way better than the original Nes, ps1, DS versions and emulators. If you can handle the clumsiness that comes with touchscreen gaming this game is one of the best in playsotre.   5/5 would recommend.  for more info on the game itself, look up some general reviews.
My favorite part in the DQ series
A long time fan of DQ series, just wish it could be played in landscape and had better translation. Would also be nice if there was an option to switch languages
Love the updated graphics from original NES version. Ohhhhhhhh the memories
Really good port of the DS game
Great JRPG for my down time at work.

There wasn't anything I didn't like about this game. I played the original game on the nes years ago when it first came out. I still have it complete in the box. Oh my, those graphics. This is a beautiful port of a great game. Finished all of the bonus material. Highly recommended.
Wonderful game with a  great port.
Long-time DQ fan, so I had to have this one üòÅ

This isn't just a great port of DS, but better because it restores the cut Party Chat.  I wish it could play in landscape, but this works just fine.  Now, if only we could get VII and the Mystery Dungeon spinoffs.
My favorite NES game love having this on my phone

The game itself is very good. Classic jRPG gameplay, great soundtrack, memorable characters...and party chat! Finally! But I have to take off two stars for the glitch that kept cloud save from working for two and a half months. It's fine now, but who knows when another bug will come along? And if you look at FF7, you'll see that sometimes Squeenix Android bugs just never get fixed. Buy at your own risk!
I beat the 8 bit nes dragon warrior 4. This app has a different beginning. But still the same game with better graphics and added diagonal movement. It is dope.
Loved playing this game on NES when I was a kid, I pretty much own every version of it. 10/10 would rescue the wee bairns again.

Love this game. Graphics are amazing. Story is great. Loved the original NES version as well as the DS remake, (of which this seems to be a direct port). [[UPDATE: Cloud Save errors fault of SAMSUNG not SQUAREENIX. Updated to 4 Stars, SQUAREENIX should put the pressure on SAMSUNG to fix the bug.  But the cloud save feature does not work. Every time I click it it forces my Google play services to force stop. Have tried on phone, tablet, and older phone I use for games and testing only. Will give 5 stars once fixed.
I want to give this 5 stars as I have been a fan of DQ since the NES but cloud saves are broken and the English translation could use some work.
When I want to connect to the cloud save on Huawei smart phone or tablet it showed the message 'connection failed' all the time. Please fix it.
Can't cloud save. Says check connection but I have connection
The port is excellent itself.   The only problems is that the cloud save does not work, and the joystick controls can be gittery and difficult to get use to.
Loads better than the NES version I owned in the 90s. Love it!

Game is classic and enjoyable. Music is good quality (not quiiite the PSX quality version, but better than DS). Cloud save broken as hell on both Samsung Galaxy S4 and my new phone ZTE Axon 7. Cant transfer save to new phone! Please Fix and rating will adjust positively!
I switched to an LGk10 and cloud save isnt working, please fix it.
Cloud save not working as of 11/27/16
I played the original one on the NES system and great improvement to the game in this version.  Great graphics and extras in this version that were not in the NES one Highly recommend
Cloud save doesn't work
Have played since the beginning and  is an awesome series
Family library support for supporting fans! Nice move guys, please keep the updates coming.
We wanna play all the japanese exclusives

The casino is too hard to make tokens.  I've been trying for days to make any tokens.  It was easier on nes.  The poker table should let you bet more then 10, the slots more then 5, and the monster fights are to random.
Okay but controls need fine tuning

4, 5, and 6 are all good ports of the best games in the series, but DQ4 is unique in that it adds party chat which was missing from the DS version. The other two games should just be played on a DS emulator.
I  find  the  controls  difficult  to  master  plus  I took  a  star off  for  the  lack of  work   you've  done  on Immigrant  town
You save your game and you have to continue to start at the beginning.   Very ridiculous
Cracking little game controls work like a dream

Love the game, but the cloud save option is perfect to allow me to change from over device to another.

First time playing DQ was DQ8 on ps2 and it quickly became a favourite game. Found this in my phone store and just had to try it! Not as many game features as DQ8 but as I jumped back 4 games thats completely understandable. Absolutely love it and plan to buy DQ5 next and work my way up! Good job! Only thing is that DQ4, 5, 6 and 8 are available through my phone store but is there a DQ7?! If so can you please release on android?! Would like to work my way through in order 0_o
Been waiting so long...finally
Very good port of the version of the game I wanted since I bought DWVII. Same bad DS translation.
Love this game it's awesome!!
Name of stuff may have changed but this game children is and always will be NES Dragon Warrior... none this ds junk this is good old school fun lol.

I love the dq series since i had the first for NES.  I never had the opportunity to play 4, 5, or 6 as they were rarely available - if at all - in the US (before the ds).  This remake is a perfect adaptation of the 3d camera perfected in dq7 and the updated gameplay reduces the amount of menus and picks up the pace of the game.  Combine that with another epic story with great characters and colorful designs - akira toriyama and the developers have recreated yet another timeless gem.  On to dq5!
Nice work

Very fun game. I am a huge Dragon Quest fan. You know what you're getting into. My 2 complaints...the story was a little weak. And I had to do way more level grinding than normal. Loved that the game is broken up into chapters and in the last chapter everyone meets up. Fleshes out the charters well. Very good game.
Try to reinstall but error on Samsung note 3
WHERE IS DRAGON QUEST VII!!!!!? üëéüëéüëé.
One of the best RPGs you'll play.  Portrait-only is kind of lame and the controls take some getting used to, but the solid gameplay and story earn this game 5 stars.

Not just a great JRPG, but the vest version of it yet released.  Square-Enix so often spits on customers that it's a real surprise to see such a loving and well-executed port.  All the bonus content and improved graphics of the DS version plus a reworked Hoffman's Town - truly gorgeous.
A great game can't stop playing it.
Need to mute quiet is not mute.  Music espn radio rather listen to anything else

I played FF series first and just started to play Dragon Quest series recently. Surprisingly for me, Dragon Quest is more compelling with its "not-so-serious" story line. Bought I to IV, and now waiting for V to be discounted. Finger crossed.
Another excellent port for one of the best games in the series.
Another enix masterpiece the best like all of the series

Dragon Quest works great on mobile platforms, and Square Enix's Android port of the DS remake of DQIV really shines (or is it "slimes?"). Modern Android screens are leagues better than the DS's so the colors and sprite work of the monsters and environments really pop.
Amazing optimization. One downside is that there is no option to mute the sound.
Love the game but the joystick is wayyyy too loose I run into walls and go in and out of stairs too easy when I only mean to walk away from them other than that its solid.
Long time jrpg enthusiast. Game has pulled me in, so that is saying something.  I will also play 5 and 6 if their price drops. Thank you for the port.

The Dragon quest games are some of my favorite games and this port holds up to that if you've never played Dragon quest I highly suggest it but it is long so it requires a lot of time and dedication and can be challenging at times but those are a couple of reasons why this game is great(and this is a good one to start with PS my favorite is 5)

Great implementation of a DS game. Missing party chat is back in, fully translated. One handed control works great, perfect for a game that needs longer play sessions for a mobile game. And it's one of the best DQ games. I hope we get the VII 3DS port now that that's being translated... Or DQIX, which would be great to have an excuse to play multi in again.
Love the remake, but is there not a way to turn the sound off?  All I see is "Quiet", which is still louder than the podcasts and normal music that I listen to while playing

I lucked into a copy of the original NES edition 20 years ago and have been playing DQIV for years.  When Square Enix decided to port this to Nintendo DS, I was ecstatic.  Now, I can play one of the most beloved games of my youth from my phone without having to carry a system around with me!
Great Port... The touchscreen controls are great and the game is optimized really well for Android. However, there should have been a landscape mode for this and there is no excuse for omitting that.
This was my first dragon quest game i played, but not last. Music is good, controls are good, graphic is old, but good, and everything else is just perfect.

The Zenithia trilogy in particular (4/5/6) have received outstanding ports! A recent patch also fixed the cloud saves in DQ4. Thanks a ton for fixing that Square Enix! GREAT GAMES!! Bring on Dragon Quest 7!!
Thanks for fixing the cloud save issue!
Classic plus more!
One of the best port, but has some issues with cloud sync
The game was fantastic, easily worth the price.
on my phone

Don't know what the other guys talkin about with the translation and stuff I understood the first and second chapter fine once I IMAGINED THAT THEY ALL HAVE SCOTTISH AND EAST EUROPEAN ACCENTS!!! Only problem is the cloud saving won't let me upload or sync.
When I try to take the slime with me in the well where the missing kids go. It freezes every time
I loved getting into this game but had to switch devices 15 hours in. The cloud saving persisted that I wasn't connected to the internet so it wouldn't update.
This is a great port of the legendary series DQ. I highly recommended.
Translations are mediocre at times but you can easily spend 40 hours on this game if you like RPGs.
Dragon fun
The items do not transfer over chapter to chapter like the DS version.      I expect this to be exactly like the ds game since its ported from it
One of the very few good ports that they have made.  But vertical-only orientation, and the fact that it is Squenix make this a 1.
It's disturbing how many people are unable to tell that the dialogue is done to try to display the NPC's accents.  There's absolutely nothing "wrong" with it, other than the fact that it's annoying.
awesome
"I have idea! Old Starek might have helpful knowledge on this problem. He live in room close by back garden from castle" Seriously? This is embarrassing.
This is my first time playing dq 4 and this is the perfect way to enjoy this great rpg
Just amazing... To screw up the translation that bad and the terrible accents wtf who was in charge while the programmers massacred this great title
I've always enjoyed DQ games, and this one is a classic. Great storytelling.

I have a problem.  It is the inability to use the stylus on my Galaxy Note2 and Galaxy Note 10.1.  I have the same issue with DQ8. Strangely,  DQ1, DQ2, and DQ3 do not have that problem. I am just guessing, but i doubt DQ5 has it. I know you can fix this. Please fix this in an update for DQ IV and DQ VIII.  I should also note that I can use the stylus with ALL Final Fantasy mobile versions.         NOTE: It appears I was being too optimistic. No S-pen support for DQ5. This really sucks! Downgrade to 1 star.

Another great DQ game. Another great story, character stats set up. Got it on nes, psx, Ds, and now phone e if that tells you how great of a game it is. Many chars to choose from worth the money. Wish SE could make more console games in the us.
Really good I like dragon quest one desire LANDSCAPE.
Love how square enix is remaking dragon quest for mobile phones. They just keep getting better and they are not pay to win. Thank god.
Great game, played straight through, bring on the next one.

As fun as the original and with the same great music and pace. The only thing that was needing major Improvement was the translation. It's 2015 and there's no reason for the English to sound like it was run through Google translate with a few shots of whiskey. It's all sorts of awkward and the entire first chapter is full of Michael Meyers characters playing Scottish accent. No... Just no. Copy and paste the original text. Easy peasy. You don't do accents in text based games, especially heavy ones.
I love all my Dragon Quest downloads. Hopefully they'll release DQ V and the other games in the series that were previously unreleased in the US.

It's some weird 3D reinvention of the original and it's really obnoxious and confusing. The 3D ads nothing to the game. The controls make it way harder to play than the original. The adaptations of 1 through 3 have been really good. I can't say the same for this one. Hopefully the port of DQ5 will be better.
A good port of the ds version of this game. Everything looks and works great. My only criticism is that the camera controls are a slightly clunky. Recommended.
I think you should improve direction controller. I don't know about language that you intend or not, it difficult to read.

The people that are saying this is a bad translation are illiterate. They are using Scottish words and spelling out the accent phonetically. The bad reviews saying they should hire an English speaking translator are hilariously ironic.
Another masterpiece remake
The dialog is all supposed to be in different accents, and people seem to be thinking that is a translation error. It's actually quite endearing, this game is certainly worth your time.
Fantastic
Have to reset the phone and re download the game every time I want to play it. Waste of $15.

This is an incredible and exciting release for a timeless classic from the annals of RPG history. I read some reviews complaining about the new translation, and I realize now that they don't realize that Ragnar McRyan is supposed to be Scottish (along with everyone else in his kingdom). Bairn is an old English word with roots in the Scottish highlands. It means child or baby. Also, ken is an old English verb that means to know something, also commonly associated with Scots.

My favorite series! 5 stars if it didn't crash so much, but at least it's easier to save than old NES version. As far as translation, its great. Ch. 1 has a Scottish dialect, 2 Russian,3 welsh/lowlands etc. Which gives it a more worldly feel than old NES version.

The game is great. Graphic is as expected which isn't a problem to me at all. But I hardly understand what's going on in Chapter 1. The language is just weird. Overall highly recommended for Dragon Quest fans.

Ignore the reviews trashing this game's translation. In reality, the translation reflects the regional dialects of the world portrayed throughout. This, and many other details, make this game an experience to behold.
Likes to eat your saved games, watch out
If you are RPG lover then should you missed this one of the great game in the epic? Buy it, play it and enjoy!!!
For the people whining about the translations, each town is supposed to have a different accent. DQ games have always had those...
If you remember those nintendo days, then youll want this to heighten that trip down memory lane.  What did it for me is that they animated the monsters, I had to have it!

For all those complaining about translation.  They redid the text based on different dialects or accents. For example, chapter one was a Scottish dialect. Actually makes game more fun to replay. Have some imagination people!
What Is Up With The translations? Favorite rpg series but seriously? Translations must be done by some one who doesn't speak english

Great game, all the proper features.  Graphics are good but could be better.  The 3D is highres, but still using low res vertex snap points.  Making the 3D lack proper geometry.  The game really needs to auto save.  I play on the bus, hard to save big issue.  The dpad really needs to be the way it is playing FF6 reading the comments I believe everyone agrees.  Please here my comments.  Playing vertical makes sense.  Dropping to 1 star until these bugs are fixed.
God dammit priest! Shut up and save my game already... *Update* took away a star, translation is HORRIBLE. WTH square, you had this done right in the 90's.

I love this game, but it always crashed!! I tried close all other apps but it still crashed!! if anyone got a way to prevend it from crashing please let me know. btw I'm using Galexy S4 with latest firmware.

If you've never played this and you enjoy RPGs , then you have to give this one a try. If you played it a long time ago like me on the NES, it's worth playing again. They did a good job remaking this classic. They don't make games like this anymore. By far the best in the series. Awesome storyline pulls you in for a grand adventure.
Playstation One RPGs are usually great.

Played 1-8, 4, 5 and 6 are definitely one of the best RPG games ever made.  Playing on android phone is really cool, except for the control which occasionally causing stress, other than a bit odd and hard to read translations the game is perfect.  I must say they went through all the trouble to make the translation unique, which is very good, is just it'll be much easier to relax and enjoy the game with ordinary English.
Great game true to the NES version but the controls blow. I recommend it to anyone who played this back in the day.

DQIV is just like how I remembered it, minus translation. Android looks like the DS in terms of graphics. Directional pad takes getting used to but touch screen is easy enough. Story is one of my favorites. I'm used to playing the Japanese version, so the translation kinda bugs me but it's good enough to understand. If you haven't played DQ before and you're an old school RPG fan, highly recommend. Quick save allows to continue almost anywhere, saves time, love it. Cloud save. Looking forward to V, IV & IX.

I absolutely loved Dragon Warrior IV add a kid and this game is a GREAT stroll down memory lane. Admittedly, the controls are a bit clunky and the alterations to the dialogue to affect regional accents does get annoying, and the graphics are far from top notch, but what else do we elect from a port of such an old game? Personally, in spite of my complaints, I live, love, love this game and plan to pass it on to my 8-year-old once I've played through 2 or 3 times :-)

I loved the game and all its concepts but there are some minor errors if u look closely. For instance when playing a female hero and you have just acquired the zenithian equipment, kyril calls the hero a he, not a she.

First of all, let me tell you that my favorite arc for this classic game was Taloon the Merchant when I first played it as a kid. There are some differences in the DS port from Dragon Warrior 4 but I could get past that. However, there is a terrible glitch towards the end of this arc when Taloon sets up his shop. His wife gives him what the shop has made, except the gold does not reflect it at all! Part of the fun of this arc is getting stuff for the shop to sell, and because of this glitch, I can't!
In terms of music, story, graphics, replayability, fun and overall quality, this entry is further proof that Dragon Quest is the series that takes a hammer to Final Fantasy and obliterates it.
Classic turn based jrpg. Great game play, controls are ok, translation is laughable,  stable for me. Can't beat this game in this genre on android.

Great port of the ds version of the game and don't listen to the reviews complaining about the translation. The translation team went the extra mile and added regional accents to some of the towns in the game
The game is great,  but oh my god the translations are bad.  It looks like Google translate was the translator of choice.

Game is great, but the translation needs a lot of work. Would it kill you to use the text from dragon warrior 4? Or hire an English speaking person to work with the translator you have? Still not sure how they got bairne or whatever it was for children. Only online walkthrough and translation sites are making some of the clues make sense

Haters will hate.  Portrait is neglected on almost all premium games.  Normally you gotta look like a schmuck holding your phone sideways with two hands to kill time waiting for the greyhound.  Great game, great port, great price.  Kudos to SquareEnix for a brave step towards a more varied mobile gaming market. LG G2.
Great remake that deserves 4 to 4.5 stars, but not as good as the original.  For some reason it keeps crashing in one of the later dungeons, so I'm hoping to see a patch for that.

This has been my favorite RPG since I first bought Dragon Warrior 4 on the NES. This however is easily the definitive version, adding in the amazing party chat missing in the DS version. Controls are excellent, making it easy to play with one hand. One of the few games better on a phone than a tablet. A must buy for JRPG fans.
I like it. I've purchased it.

I m so happy they decided to release the dragon quest series on Android.  I'll buy them all. Hoping for the remake of DQ3 next. Funny tho that some things like the dishes for dinner and stuff is in high def but the characters are still on old 8 bit graphics.

Great classic game.

One of the greatest
The game is quite the thing the fan club expected it to be.  The storyline is great,  the game play is smooth. There is no hi-end graphics here but it is one of the classics!

Brings me back to when I was a kid. However, with lots of obvious enhancements.

A fine port of the DS version of the game. The only knock is the translation is sloppy. Still even with the silly translations it's a great buy.
Just like everyone said, fix the control system. Make it like ff series,  where u can touch the controller anywhere on the screen.

I love the series, and really loved this game as a kid.  So much in fact, I have an original copy, but NES on the go is a problem.  When I saw this port with some updated graphics, I was super excited, but it's letting me down.  If you want a great RPG on your mobile, check it out, but the names have been changed to some ridiculous ones that don't stick to the series.  Items and monsters, I might have let slide, but places and character names were changed and it's just kicking me in the childhood.

Put in a few hours over the weekend.  It appears to be a complete port from the DS version.  This would probably explain the portrait orientation - going from the 2 screens on the DS seems to translate into a portrait final product.  No bugs yet, can move the dpad to one side or the other as well resize it allowing for one or two handed play.  Hopefully still works fine once ART becomes mandatory.
Fantastic game that brings back memories. Too bad you can only play vertically. The built in controller is fairly sloppy and the play control is a bit too quick.

Please update your UI elements to use XXHDPI assets. Text and UI are quite blurry on an XXHDPI device like the OnePlus.

Dragon Warrior 4 on the 8-bit NES was and still is my favorite video game of all time.  This version is based on the Nintendo DS remake, which was also good. I gave 5 stars out of love for the Dragon Quest series, but it could use a bit of polish to be perfect. I hope we will get texture upgrades to go better with the high resolution screens of today. It would be super cool if Square-Enix would sneak in a playable version of the original game in a future update.

This game is a great port of the DS version. The dual screen nature of the original translates well to fit the potrait view of smartphones. Would have given 5 stars if SE adds in gamepad support, which is my major complaint. Having quicksave available at all locations would be another good thing to add. Good job on added the party chat back into the game.
I don't understand the insistence to use vertical in the dq games, it's much more enjoyable and logical playing these types of hands horizontally
its just like the ds version. with the added psaro chapter.  everyone should support this game
everyone shhould play this amazing classic

DQV + VIII are actually my favorites in the series but this is actually a decent port of the DS game. Would be great if there were higher textures for the menus and such but aside from that it does the job. It runs a lot better and I hope DQV comes out soon.
This is a great mobile port of Dragon Quest IV.
More DQ Square-Enix

One the best games in the series and easily the best RPG back in the NES days.  I wanted to give 5 stars, but with low resolution textures and no controller support I docked a star.  Square-Enix needs to quit being lazy with their ports and add the features that should be standard.
